```{r}
# Load necessary packages
library(codebookr)
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(readr)
```

# Purpose of the program

Using the CodebookR package, we will create a data dictionary for follow-up interview data for the DETECT project pertaining to self-report injury, violence, neglect, and exploitation.

# Load cleaned data

```{r}
#| warning: false
sr <- readRDS("../data/cleaned_rds_files/self_report_import.rds")
```

# Set column attributes

```{r}
#Set the source to "DETECT Follow-up Interview Questions Self Report" for all the variables
sr_vars <- sr %>% 
  select(1:353) %>% 
  names()

for(i in sr_vars) {
  attr(sr[[i]], "source") <- "DETECT Follow-up Interview Questions - Self Report"
}
```

```{r}
# Choose variables that will not have summary statistics
no_stats <- sr %>%
  select(1:14,346:353)

no_stats_vars <- colnames(no_stats)
```

# Pass data frame to the codebook() function

```{r}
# Add title and description to codebook
self_report_codebook <- codebook(
  df = self_report,
  title = "Self Report Dataset",
  description = "Data collected during DETECT follow-up interviews on self-report of injury, violence, neglect, and exploitation.",
  no_summary_stats = no_stats_vars)
```

```{r}
print(self_report_codebook, "self_report_codebook.docx")
```
